text:
Currently DavFileSystem is using org.apache.util.HttpURL and not 
org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpURL, which WebdavResource is.  I'm using 
Slide 2.1 and the jcrri.jar from the jsr170 project.
creator: Robert_Flaherty@Hyperion.com
stefan@apache.org
text:
after i started to migrate DavFileSystem to the webdavclient lib of slide 2.1
i discovered more issues in the implementation of DavFileSystem.

as DavFileSystem is a leftover from an early version of the jcr ri and is not 
used anymore i decided to remove it rather than fixing it, sorry.

creator: Robert_Flaherty@Hyperion.com
text:
Was it really that different.  Just seems that having yet another storage 
option is useful, if not just for testing sake.

creator: stefan@apache.org
text:
well, i experienced some differences and i started recoding several methods of
DavFileSystem before i decided that it's not worth the effort because: 

1) upgrading to the slide 2.0 webdavclient lib and newer commons-httpclient 
would introduce additional dependencies (commons-logging, dom2.jar) which is 
potentially asking for trouble/conflicts.

2) most importantly, the DavFileSystem is not suited for the current 
persistence model of the jcr ri where the state of a node and its properties is 
stored in multiple very small files. the performance would be unbearable.
